subject: JUnit FAQ for private methods, db testing?
msgSnippet: Hello, I looked at the JUnitFAQ.txt uploaded on yahoo, but couldn t find information about the existence (and utility) of private methods, as also of db
messageBody:
Hello,
I looked at the JUnitFAQ.txt uploaded on yahoo, but couldn't find
information about the existence (and utility) of private methods, as
also of db testing/sql testing etc. Am I looking at an older version, or
is there a different document with this information? In case there
isn't, I wouldn't mind going through the archive, collecting the
opinions, and adding them in there if it makes sense.
Thanks,
Nilesh

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin O'Sullivan [mailto:kosullivan@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, November 12, 2003 11:22 AM
> To: Junit@Yahoogroups. Com
> Subject: [junit] Is there a place for private methods with TDD?
>
>
> In a class (see below) with two public methods A & B that both call
> private
> method C, what's the best approach for unit testing it? Should test
> scenarios for A or B cover what may happen in C ? If so, is it just
> accepted
> as a code management overhead to ensure that C is properly tested via
> tests
> for A or B ?
>
> If you use TDD would you ever end up with private methods, declaring
them
> as
> protected instead?
>
> class MyClass
> {
> public void A()
> {
> ...
> C();
> }
> public void B()
> {
> ...
> C();
> }
> private void C()
> {
> ...
> }
> }
>
>
> ---
